blog.name: gravitypiglet
blog.title: Pig slop
blog.description: Presonal blog for stupid art I try to create and other things I find wonderful or amazing that I just HAVE to reshare

summary: I really wanted to try drawing Jester, a real Jester. Not like the ones I've done before that were without reference photos and...
caption:
I really wanted to try drawing Jester, a real Jester. Not like the ones I’ve done before that were without reference photos and me having lacked even the common courtesy to catch up to Critical Role. Jester is amazing. She’s beautiful and fun, has a sense of humor but a serious side too. Despite her rough life she has hope and love. I really like her style and laughter.

That is all to say: I love Jester and she deserves the world.

summary:
You know how in The Adventure Zone: Balance Arc, there's canonically a town where everyone is Tom Bodett?
With how the chat is,...
body:
You know how in The Adventure Zone: Balance Arc, there’s canonically a town where everyone is Tom Bodett?

With how the chat is, you’d think that Shady Creek Run is just Taliesin Jaffe. The brothel clerks, the prostitute, the guards at the gates, the Mardun estate, Lorenzo’s gang, and Lorenzo himself, it’s just Taliesin in different clothes.

tags: i hope i did that scene justice because holy hell
summary: Caleb to Nila, pointing nearby: Hey, over there is a tree stump on the side of the road. That’s the bald one, what do you do? ...
body:
Caleb to Nila, pointing nearby: Hey, over there is a tree stump on the side of the road. That’s the bald one, what do you do?

Beau: Show us.

Nila, modestly: I will tell you because I cannot do it all the time. But when I am ready…

Beau, with an understanding nod: Okay.

Caleb, frustrated: [turns away to hide his panic]

Nila, soft face quickly hardening in to a furious scowl: I will summon lightning from the sky. [voice and expression intensify] And fry him. DESTROY him. And I can do it again. And again. AND AGAIN.

Caleb, Beau, Keg and Nott simultaneously: That sounds good. / Yeah, that sounds great. / Okay yeah that sou- seems good. / We would appreciate that.

body:
if they give fjord molly’s sword would the falchion absorb its powers or does that only work with heavy two-handed weapons?

because if it did absorb it then molly would forever be a part of the m9, helping to keep them safe even in death.

summary: a trope describes pradigmatic storytelling devices and narrative tools, they are not exhaustive ways of measuring the quality of...
body: a trope describes pradigmatic storytelling devices and narrative tools, they are not exhaustive ways of measuring the quality of any one particular narrative element. even tropes that are generally bad need not be inherently, bad depending on how it is utilized. This is why TV Tropes itself continually states throughout the website that Tropes Are Tools and Tropes Are Not Bad. Just. Since we’re talking about tropes and all.

reblog.comment: a trope describes pradigmatic storytelling devices and narrative tools, they are not exhaustive ways of measuring the quality of any one particular narrative element. even tropes that are generally bad need not be inherently, bad depending on how it is utilized. summary: I don't really know any fellow critters. I was super happy to realize that I am not alone in grieving Molly. HOW CAN I LOVE A...
question: I don't really know any fellow critters. I was super happy to realize that I am not alone in grieving Molly. HOW CAN I LOVE A D&D CHARACTER SO MUCH?!?!?!?! (new to watching other play) I can't stop thinking about his first resurrection. Why did it happen? Was he really dead that time or his friends just thought that he was dead? Was the reason he came had something to do with the way he died? Was he actually not dead? Maybe it was supposed to be a con, which went wrong? Or does he have 9 lives?
answer: Molly is actually a cat cleverly disguised as one (1) purple tiefling

trail.content_raw: Molly is actually a cat cleverly disguised as one (1) purple tiefling

summary: Nila, softly but with conviction: Anyway, I have some abilities that I would like to use on these bad people. Keg: Killing...
body:
Nila, softly but with conviction: Anyway, I have some abilities that I would like to use on these bad people.

Keg: Killing abilities?

Nila: Yes

Keg: Are you willing to kill?

Nila, without hesitation: Yes.

Keg: Can you say “fuck” for me?

Nila, after a confused pause: I do not know what it means, but “fuck.”

Keg, nodding in satisfaction: Great.

blog.name: pangurbanthewhite
blog.title: Phantasmal and resplendant
blog.description: I write fanfic. I like to think it is awesome fanfic. You can find my work at AO3 under CatKing_Catkin. Credit for icon art goes to bottleshark here on tumblr.

summary: I know this isn’t a guarantee, and I’m still not ready to hope.  But fuck, it is still such a weight off my mind to know that...
body:
I know this isn’t a guarantee, and I’m still not ready to hope.

But fuck, it is still such a weight off my mind to know that they’re at least going to try and that the show is acknowledging - unlike so many fans - that characters don’t just poof into nonexistence if they die at a low level because clerics other than PC clerics should exist in the world.

Molly deserves a chance. Molly deserves at least what Pike got.

I know it’s not a guarantee but it was still so nice to hear that this is a goal the remainder of the gang are pursuing. I hope they at least get a resurrection ritual.

(Maybe the weird rumor mentioned could even circumvent the ten day limit? Pretty please? That’s what’s stressing me out the most at the moment - they technically only have like at most six days to wrap things up.)

Whatever else happens, I am so so so glad that Nott also mentioned that Molly inviting everyone to the carnival is the reason the Mighty Nein exists because the fact that they came together by sheer crazy random happenstance, by this one twist of fate, has always been really cool to me and I’m glad they gave that the weight it deserved.
